𒋻 tar 𒀠𒋻 al-tar altar "mighty" tar Old English 'brave' or 'strong' 𒋻 tar תַּר tar meaning 'row' 'line' or 'formation' but also used metaphorically for strength or power 𒋻 tar 𒄑𒀠𒋻 𒀠𒋻 al-tar tarea 'task' or 'work' @Spanish "apportioned work" <> Zug
